title: Workshop on Developing Social Science Persuasion Strategies for Large-Scale Online Education Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic instructional design concepts and foundational knowledge of social science research methods (e.g., observation, variable control)
context.additional_context: Classroom enabling group discussions and individual practice in BYOD environments. Focuses on improving learners' critical thinking skills through case analyses based on sociocultural theory.

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three social science persuasion techniques (e.g., social proof, authority, consistency) applicable to online instructional design.
Learners design experiments analyzing the effectiveness of persuasion strategies using mixed research methods (quantitative + qualitative).
Learners submit prototype design plans applying culturally contextualized persuasion strategies to real educational scenarios.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
